bug.author: timokau
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/pip>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/pip</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
There are no binary wheels for tensorflow 1.14 for mac (should be <denchmark-link:https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/cpu/tensorflow-1.14.0-py3-none-any.whl>here</denchmark-link> ) and the documentation page still points to 1.13. Is 1.14 still considered unstable? Was the wheel generation and documentation update simply forgotten? Or is it normal that it takes a couple of days after the release?

comments.comment: Any update on when the wheels will appear on the googleapis storage? They exist on pypi?
Seems there was a bug in the release process pipeline. We'll (try to) solve this issue this week, sorry about this.
Added <denchmark-link:https://github.com/av8ramit>@av8ramit</denchmark-link> too. I wonder if there's a desync between our upload scripts.
It appears the 1.14 build upload was not completed. Can you try again now please?
Yes, the downloads work now! The <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/pip>documentation</denchmark-link> still points to 1.13 though.
I think <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lamberta>@lamberta</denchmark-link> can fix the documentation link, assigning to him
